numbered_ace_sentences: 1. This graph is a scatter plot.
2. This graph has a dividing line.
3. This graph compares responses from younger generations and older generations.
4. The responses come from 21 countries.
5. In most of the 21 countries, most younger people think that the world is getting better.
6. In most of the 21 countries, most older people think that the world is barely getting better.
7. This graph shows that different generations view the world differently.
8. Different generations have different experiences.
9. People see changes in the country where they live.
10. These changes can affect how people view the world.
11. In general, people who live in Africa are more optimistic.
12. India has a high percentage of optimism.
13. Nigeria has a high percentage of optimism.
14. In India, the percentage of optimism is higher in the older generation than in the younger generation.
15. In Nigeria, the percentage of optimism is higher in the older generation than in the younger generation.
16. People in these countries have witnessed a shift in living conditions.
17. People in these countries have witnessed economic growth.
18. These observations can increase optimism.
19. The audience of the graph may include people from many countries.
20. The audience of the graph may include people of many ages.
